channel.title: Where should our Workshop Group 1 output go?
channel.description:
Continuing the discussion from [OGM Workshop Group 1 output](https://forum.openglobalmind.com/t/ogm-workshop-group-1-output/413/4):
It's easy to change the category, what are good suggestions? Right now it's in the site feedback category because it was continuing a discussion about "moderating the site":
> *In terms of what it means to moderate a forum like this, maybe some of the patterns that we worked on in Group 1 in the workshop can be used in a somewhat ‘pastoral’ role. I’ll add info in another thread.*
But probably the more logical category is "Designing the system". I moved it there.

item.title: Where should our Workshop Group 1 output go?
item.dc:creator: lovolution
item.description:
continue here:

OGM Workshop Group 1 output Designing the System
Continuing the discussion from Forming a Moderation Team: Status: Workshop discussion ✓ Follow-up processing ✓ Collated and revised as text ✓ Jointly workshopped again ✓ Still to do: Feedback and revision to support practical use with the whole OGM community "Making of" doc is here. Visual summary [OGM Workshop Team 1, 29 October 2020 - New frame] Text (626 words) 1. Core Purpose: Connect the connectors to what they need to thrive CONTEXT: In the context of ongoing learning and unlearn…

Read full topic
item.source: Where should our Workshop Group 1 output go?

item.title: Where should our Workshop Group 1 output go?
item.dc:creator: holtzermann17
item.description:
Continuing the discussion from OGM Workshop Group 1 output:

It’s easy to change the category, what are good suggestions? Right now it’s in the site feedback category because it was continuing a discussion about “moderating the site”:

In terms of what it means to moderate a forum like this, maybe some of the patterns that we worked on in Group 1 in the workshop can be used in a somewhat ‘pastoral’ role. I’ll add info in another thread.

But probably the more logical category is “Designing the system”. I moved it there.

Read full topic
item.source: Where should our Workshop Group 1 output go?
